page.title: 12Industry. Employment.
page.content: is now used. 50 men work at the Tannery; different skills are needed for different jobs. Protective clothing, such as gloves, Wellingtons and leggings, is needed when working with lime. The leather goes through these stages: washing, soaking in lime pits, removal of hair and flesh, cutting, tanning, drying and bleaching. Finished leather is rolled, polished and classified. Leather from the Tannery is used to make saddles, bridles, weight-lifting belts, soles and heels for shoes. Leather for the Household Cavalry has been tanned at Downton. The leather is exported mainly to the Far East, America, Italy and Ireland. The work is not dangerous if yoy are careful, Mr. Birch told us. He would not make any changes to the tanning process but sees a time when machines will replace more men.
